name: transistor production, surface-mounted | transistor, surface-mounted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8342/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of al SMD transistor for surface mounting, It is based on the assumption that a typical SMD transistor in electronic modules has an average weight of 0.593 g. The data represent a typical SMD transistor for surface mounting used in the information and communication technology. Material data are taken from datasheets of producers of such transistors and from the literature. Infrastructure and production efforts are based on own assumptions. The production efforts represent not a specifictransistor type and have thus, accordingly higher uncertainties.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of metals and plastics at the factory gate.

This dataset includes raw material input and production efforts for the production of currently used SMD transistors for surface mounting technology.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent a global valuable composition of SMD transistors
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: average production composed of: Si-crystal die bonding; wire bonding; encapsulation; plating; triming; forming and marking.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
A transistor “is a semiconductor device, the most common type of which acts as a current amplifier. There do however exist less common types of transistor - FETs (field effect transistors) - which act as voltage controlled resistors.”
Currently, there is a huge variety of different types of transistors on the market. Main characteristics are differences in the semiconductor material used, the structure, the polarity, the maximum power rating, the maximum operating frequence or the physical packaging.

flow.name: transistor, surface-mounted
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
Calculated Value. The production of 1 kg of transistors lead to a waste amount of 4.9 kg unused raw materials. Hence, this dataset here has an input of 5.9 kg of raw materials per kg of transistor. The split to the different raw materials (metals, plastics, etc.) is based on the reported  material specifications.

Further references:
ST Microelectronics (2004) Chemical Content of Semiconductor Packaging. PDF from <http://www.stmicroelectronics.com/stonline/company/environm/report03/envi03.pdf>.
